intro: Acianthera alpestris, commonly known as the alpine acianthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
